Our military installations in Hampton Roads are very vulnerable to flooding. It’s clear that recurrent flooding and sea level rise undermine military readiness and national security. (1/2)

As a strong advocate for animal rights and a pet owner myself, I will continue supporting legislation to protect all animals. (2/2)

I am happy to hear that the Protect Animal Cruelty and Torture (PACT) Act was signed into law. This new law makes gruesome and despicable acts of animal cruelty a federal crime. (1/2) https://people.com/pets/pact-act-signed-law-animal-cruelty/ …
May 31, 2019 was a day that will forever change Virginia Beach. We will always remember the 12 lives that we lost that day and their irreplaceable contributions to our #VBStrong community. (3/3)

During our darkest hour, we showed the world the strength and resolve that defines us. We saw first responders heroically running into Building 2 to save others, doctors working long hours to provide victims with expert care, and countless other displays of courage. (2/3)

Six months ago, an unfathomable tragedy struck our community. On May 31, 12 wonderful people lost their lives in the Virginia Beach mass shooting. My heart continues to grieve for those who lost their lives, their families, and everyone who loved them. (1/3)

Shark finning is when people catch sharks, cut off their fins, and toss the sharks back into the water, where they will bleed to death. I urge the Senate to ensure that America no longer participates in this cruel practice by passing the Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act. (2/2)

I was pleased to join my colleagues from both sides of the aisle in voting for the Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act. This bill would combat the inhumane practice of shark finning by making it a federal crime to sell, purchase, or possess shark fins. (1/2) http://www.capecharlesmirror.com/news/us-house-of-representatives-passes-shark-fin-sales-elimination-act/ …
I urge the Senate to provide relief to America's most heroic families by immediately voting on and passing the SECURE Act. (2/2)

Gold Star Families gave the ultimate sacrifice for our nation and it’s wrong that the 2017 tax law caused them to see a tax hike. Months ago, the SECURE Act, which contains my provision to fix this flaw, passed the House. (1/2) https://thehill.com/policy/national-security/470393-lawmakers-under-pressure-to-pass-benefits-fix-for-military-families …

Earlier this year, I introduced the Fort Monroe National Land Acquisition Act to ensure that we can keep Fort Monroe's rich history accessible for future generations. This bipartisan and bicameral bill would instruct the National Park Service to accept this land donation. (2/2)

I’m pleased by the Fort Monroe Board of Trustees’ endorsing the donation of 35 acres of shoreline to the National Park Service. Fort Monroe was the site of many pivotal moments in our nation’s history and we must protect this national monument. Among other requests in the letter, I ask that VBCPS make public the full raw data of their lead testing to allow independent toxicologists to verify the accuracy of the tests and determine that no other sites have been erroneously identified as below actionable levels. (4/4)
I am troubled that developing a communications strategy was prioritized over providing parents vital information related to the health of their children. (3/4)

Unfortunately, it fails to explain why the sites could not have been secured after a public announcement. The #TownHall conversation has now turned to issues affecting #veterans. Ahead of Veterans Day after 20 years in the Navy, I know how much our veterans sacrificed to protect our freedom. I look forward to discussing how I am championing the cause of America’s bravest men & women!

One of my top priorities is keeping the Chesapeake Bay clean and thriving. That’s why I introduced the Chesapeake Bay Program Reauthorization Act to fully fund the @EPA’s Chesapeake Bay Program. This will help distribute grants to states for Bay restoration efforts.

The next topic at our #TownHall is the environment! As a staunch advocate for the Chesapeake Bay and other waterways, I support funding Bay cleanup efforts and banning offshore drilling. We must preserve our natural treasures for future generations.

The first subject of the conversation at our #TownHall is health care. I will discuss my support for protecting people with pre-existing conditions, lowering prices of prescription drugs, and making quality health care more affordable for Coastal Virginians.

The Department of Defense found that climate change is a “national security issue” and “the greater Hampton Roads area is very vulnerable to flooding caused by rising sea levels and land subsidence.” The administration should listen to our military and reverse this decision.(2/2)

Today’s decision to begin formally withdrawing from the Paris Climate Agreement threatens our coastal community and puts our military readiness at risk. (1/2) https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/2019/11/04/trump-makes-it-official-us-will-withdraw-paris-climate-accord/ …
